Avoid touching your eyes, nose and mouth.
Stay home when you are sick.
Cover your cough or sneeze with a tissue, then throw the tissue in the trash.
Clean and disinfect frequently touched objects and surfaces using a regular household cleaning spray or wipe.

Recently our FFA livestock judging team had an amazing trip to Chicago, Illinois and Indianapolis, IN for the National FFA Convention.

The team placed 15th overall out of 45 teams and received a silver medal. Tyler Gifford was 10th in the nation and received a gold award and $400. Katie Odom was 2nd overall in the swine division and received a silver award overall
Paige Pesterfield and Gracie Mitchell also received silver awards. Overall we were very excited with the results! We also had 2 EP FFA members receive the American FFA Degree; Haylee Crowe and Andrew Gmirkin.

Thank you for all the support to our FFA members!
GO EAGLES!

What does the Eagle Point School Bond mean for White City? Our district needs to address the population growth in White City and the overcrowding in our existing elementary school. Table Rock Elementary is currently at capacity with more than 800 students and there are more homes being built every day.

If the voters approve the bond in November there will be a new elementary school built in White City. Additionally, there will be extensive renovations to Upper Table Rock Elementary School. Those renovations will include upgrades to security, new HVAC systems and modern classrooms with keyless entry to help protect our students.

Many people have asked what will this cost? If the bond passes, property owners will see an increase in their yearly property taxes. If you own a home that has a value of $200,000 it could cost you and additional $15 per month in your property taxes. A $300,000 home could cost you and additional $22 per month.

If you have any questions, please visit our website:

www.EaglePointSchoolBond.org

What would the Bond cost?

If voters approve the bond in November, the incremental increase from the projected 2019 rate is estimated to be $0.89 per $1000 of assessed value.

For a property assessed at $200,000, this equates to a $178 annual increase over the current tax levy. (@ $14 per month)

District voters last approved a bond in 2000. The proceeds from this bond were used to build Eagle Rock Elementary School, Eagle Point Middle School, White Mountain Middle School, Shady Cove Middle School and other capital improvements across the District.

The Promise of Oregon: This video was filmed at 2017 graduation ceremonies at Bethel SD (Eugene), Reynolds SD (Portland), Astoria SD and Eagle Point SD (north of Medford). It captures the excitement of seniors graduating from high school and celebrating with their families and friends.

The video is the first in a series of Promise efforts in 2017-18 that will focus on improving graduation rates at Oregon high schools statewide. Look for more in coming weeks, including debut of a longer graduation video in November.
